conditions.snippet: Addisonâ€™s disease (also known as primary adrenal insufficiency or hypoadrenalism) is a rare disorder of the adrenal glands.
conditions.label: Addison's disease

conditions.snippet: Alzheimer's disease is the most common cause of dementia. Dementia is a group of symptoms associated with a decline in the way your brain functions, affecting your memory and the way you behave.
conditions.label: Alzheimer's disease

conditions.snippet: Anorexia nervosa is an eating disorder and mental health condition that can be life-threatening.
conditions.label: Anorexia nervosa

conditions.snippet: Appendicitis is a swollen appendix that gives severe increasing tummy pain. Treatment is urgent surgery
conditions.label: Appendicitis

conditions.snippet: Arthritis is a common condition that causes pain and inflammation within a joint.
conditions.label: Arthritis

conditions.snippet: Psoriasis can cause a painful and damaging inflammation of joints over time, which needs rheumatological treatment.
conditions.label: Psoriasis with arthropathy

conditions.snippet: Asthma is a long-term lung condition which currently has no cure however treatments are available to control symptoms
conditions.label: Asthma

conditions.snippet: Blepharitis is a condition where the rims of the eyelids become inflamed (red and swollen).
conditions.label: Blepharitis

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Bone Cancer (Sarcoma) including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Bone tumour

conditions.snippet: Botulism is a rare but potentially fatal infection caused by toxins produced by bacteria called Clostridium botulinum.
conditions.label: Botulism

conditions.snippet: Bronchiectasis is a long-term condition where the airways of the lungs become abnormally widened, leading to a build-up of excess mucus.
conditions.label: Bronchiectasis

conditions.snippet: Brucellosis is a bacterial infection caught from animals, which can cause long-lasting flu-like symptoms and needs to be treated with antibiotics.
conditions.label: Brucellosis

conditions.snippet: Sore, white patches in the mouth can be caused by oral thrush and can be caused by some medications, or hygiene issues
conditions.label: Candidiasis

conditions.snippet: Chickenpox is a mild and common childhood illness that most children catch at some point.
conditions.label: Varicella

conditions.snippet: Chilblains are small, itchy swellings on the skin that occur as a reaction to cold temperatures. They affect the body's extremities, such as the toes.
conditions.label: Chilblains

conditions.snippet: Iron deficiency anaemia occurs when the body does not have enough iron. The main symptoms are tiredness and lethargy (lack of energy).
conditions.label: Iron deficiency anaemia

conditions.snippet: The cholera vaccination is not recommended for all travellers, but is needed for some higher risk groups.
conditions.label: Cholera

conditions.snippet: Claustrophobia is the irrational fear of confined spaces. It affects about 10% of the UK population.
conditions.label: Claustrophobia

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about ulcerative colitis including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Ulcerative colitis

conditions.snippet: Croup is a childhood condition that affects the windpipe (trachea), the airways to the lungs (the bronchi) and the voice box (larynx).
conditions.label: Croup

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Cystic Fibrosis including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Cystic fibrosis

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Dengue including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Dengue

conditions.snippet: Clinical depression causes feelings of unhappiness, hopelessness and lack of interest in things you used to enjoy.
conditions.label: Mood disorder of depressed type

conditions.snippet: Atopic eczema, also known as atopic dermatitis, is the most common form of eczema. It mainly affects children, but can continue into adulthood.
conditions.label: Atopic neurodermatitis

conditions.snippet: Dyspraxia, a type of developmental co-ordination disorder (DCD), is a disability that affects movement and co-ordination.
conditions.label: Developmental coordination disorder

conditions.snippet: Di George syndrome is a severe genetic disorder that is noticeable at birth. At the very worst, it can result in heart defects, learning difficulties, a cleft palate and potentially many other problems.
conditions.label: DiGeorge sequence
synonyms: Agenesis of the parathyroid AND thymus glands
Third AND fourth pharyngeal pouch syndrome
Third AND fourth pharyngeal arch syndrome

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about diverticular disease and diverticulitis including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Diverticulitis

conditions.snippet: An air embolism is an air bubble trapped in a blood vessel. An air embolism usually happens when a scuba diver surfaces too quickly.
conditions.label: Air embolism

conditions.snippet: Fibromyalgia, also called fibromyalgia syndrome, is a long-term condition which causes pain all over the body.
conditions.label: Muscular rheumatism

conditions.snippet: Bird flu, or avian flu, is an infectious viral illness that spreads among birds. In rare cases, it can affect humans.
conditions.label: Avian influenza

conditions.snippet: Giardiasis (gee-ar-dye-a-sis) is an infection of the digestive system caused by tiny parasites called Giardia intestinalis.
conditions.label: Infection by Giardia lamblia

conditions.snippet: Read NHS information about Gilbertâ€™s syndrome, which is a common and harmless condition where people experience occasional episodes of jaundice (yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes).
conditions.label: Gilbert's syndrome

conditions.snippet: Gum disease, also known as gingivitis, is where the gums become swollen, sore or infected.
conditions.label: Gingival disease

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Gout including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Gout

conditions.snippet: A bunion is a bony deformity of the joint at the base of the big toe.
conditions.label: Hallux valgus

conditions.snippet: Hand, foot and mouth disease (HFMD) is a viral infection that can affect young children.
conditions.label: Enteroviral vesicular stomatitis with exanthem

conditions.snippet: A heart block is when the electrical pulses that control the beating of the heart are disrupted. Usually, only serious types of heart block cause symptoms.
conditions.label: Heart block

conditions.snippet: Heat exhaustion and heatstroke are two heat-related health conditions. If they are not quickly treated, they can both be very serious.
conditions.label: Heat exhaustion

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Haemochromatosis including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Bronze diabetes

conditions.snippet: Hepatitis is a term used to describe inflammation of the liver. It can occur as a result of a viral infection or because the liver is exposed to harmful substances such as alcohol.
conditions.label: Inflammatory disease of liver

conditions.snippet: A stye, also known as a hordeolum, is a small abscess (painful collection of pus) on the eyelid. It appears as a painful lump on the outside or inside of the eyelid.
conditions.label: External hordeolum

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about high blood pressure (hypertension), including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Hypertensive disorder

conditions.snippet: Pulmonary hypertension is raised blood pressure within the pulmonary arteries, which are the blood vessels that supply the lungs.
conditions.label: Pulmonary hypertension

conditions.snippet: An overactive thyroid produces too many thyroid hormones. Symptoms include anxiety, tiredness and weight loss.
conditions.label: Hyperthyroidism

conditions.snippet: NHS Choices information on Klinefelter syndrome, with links to other useful resources
conditions.label: Klinefelter's syndrome, XXY

conditions.snippet: Labyrinthitis is an inner ear infection. It causes a delicate structure deep inside your ear called the labyrinth to become inflamed, affecting your hearing and balance.
conditions.label: Labyrinthitis

conditions.snippet: Lactose intolerance is a digestive problem which can cause stomach upsets after eating dairy products.
conditions.label: Lactose intolerance

conditions.snippet: Laryngitis is swelling of the larynx, mostly due to viral infections or voice strains. Often treatment is not needed
conditions.label: Laryngitis

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Chronic Myeloid Leukaemia, including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Chronic myeloid leukaemia
synonyms: Chronic myelogenous leukemia, no ICD-O subtype
Chronic myelogenous leukemia, no International Classification of Diseases for Oncology subtype

conditions.snippet: Lymphoedema is swelling due to problems in the lymphatic system. Treatment isnâ€™t curative but may help control symptoms
conditions.label: Lymphedema

conditions.snippet: Marfan syndrome is a disorder of the body's connective tissues. Children usually inherit it from one of their parents.
conditions.label: Marfan's syndrome

conditions.snippet: Mastitis is a condition that causes a woman's breast tissue to become painful and inflamed. It usually occurs in women who are breastfeeding.
conditions.label: Mastitis

conditions.snippet: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease affecting nerves in the brain and spinal cord, causing problems with muscle movement, balance and vision.
conditions.label: Generalised multiple sclerosis

conditions.snippet: Mumps is a contagious viral infection that used to be common in children.
conditions.label: Mumps parotitis

conditions.snippet: Nail patella syndrome is an uncommon genetic condition that causes problems with the nails, bones, kidneys and eyes.
conditions.label: Nail-patella syndrome

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Nasal And Sinus Cancer including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Neoplasm of nose

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Panic Disorder including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Panic disorder

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about stomach ulcer including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Peptic ulcer

conditions.snippet: A pulmonary embolism is a blockage in the artery that transports blood to the lungs (pulmonary artery). It is usually caused by a blood clot.
conditions.label: Pulmonary embolism

conditions.snippet: Q fever is an infection caused by Coxiella burnetii (C. burnetii) bacteria.
conditions.label: Q fever

conditions.snippet: Read about repetitive strain injury (RSI), which is a general term used to describe the pain caused by repetitive movement and overuse of muscles, nerves and tendons.
conditions.label: Repetitive strain injury

conditions.snippet: Reye's syndrome is a very rare condition that causes serious liver and brain damage. If it is not treated promptly it may result in permanent brain injury or death.
conditions.label: Reye's syndrome

conditions.snippet: Rickets is a condition that affects bone development in children. The most common cause of rickets is a lack of vitamin D and calcium.
conditions.label: Rickets

conditions.snippet: Sciatica is the name given to any sort of pain that is caused by irritation or compression of the sciatic nerve. There are two types, acute and persistent (chronic).
conditions.label: Sciatica

conditions.snippet: NHS Choices information on scleroderma, including types of scleroderma, symptoms and causes of scleroderma, with links to other useful resources
conditions.label: Localized scleroderma

conditions.snippet: Septic shock is a life-threatening condition that happens when your blood pressure drops to a dangerously low level due to an infection.
conditions.label: Septic shock

conditions.snippet: Sick building syndrome (SBS) is a poorly understood phenomenon where people have a range of symptoms related to a certain building, most often a workplace, and there is no specific identifiable cause.
conditions.label: Sick building syndrome

conditions.snippet: Sinusitis is inflammation of the lining of the sinuses, caused by a viral or bacterial infection.
conditions.label: Sinusitis

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Subarachnoid Haemorrhage including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Subarachnoid haemorrhage

conditions.snippet: Giant cell arteritis (GCA) is a condition in which medium and large arteries, usually in the head and neck, become inflamed.
conditions.label: Temporal arteritis

conditions.snippet: Androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS) affects the development of a child's genitals and reproductive organs.
conditions.label: Androgen resistance syndrome

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Tietze's Syndrome including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Tietze's disease

conditions.snippet: Athleteâ€™s foot is a common condition that is caused by a fungal infection. An itchy red rash develops in the spaces between your toes.
conditions.label: Tinea pedis

conditions.snippet: Trichotillomania is a condition where a person feels compelled to pull their hair out.
conditions.label: Trichotillomania

conditions.snippet: Uveitis is inflammation of the middle layer of the eye, called the uvea or uveal tract.
conditions.label: Uveitis

conditions.snippet: Acute cholecystitis is inflammation (swelling) of the gallbladder, usually caused by a gallstone. The main symptom is severe pain in the upper right abdomen.
conditions.label: Acute cholecystitis

conditions.snippet: Migraines are tender headaches on one side of the head that have specific triggers and causes nausea and vomiting
conditions.label: Migraine

conditions.snippet: 'Mallet finger' is an injury to the end of the finger that causes it to bend towards the palm.
conditions.label: Mallet finger

conditions.snippet: A perforated eardrum is a hole or tear in the eardrum. It may be uncomfortable, but usually heals on its own without treatment within two months.
conditions.label: Tear of tympanic membrane

conditions.snippet: Heart failure is a serious condition caused by the heart failing to pump enough blood around the body at the right pressure.
conditions.label: Right heart failure

conditions.snippet: Vitamin B12 deficiency anaemia or folate deficiency anaemia occur when a lack of vitamin B12 or folate causes the body to produce abnormally large red blood cells.
conditions.label: Vitamin B12 deficiency

conditions.snippet: A set of lung conditions which make breathing difficult, commonly caused by smoking and can be controlled by lifestyle changes
conditions.label: Acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease
synonyms: Acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

conditions.snippet: Corticobasal degeneration (CBD) is a rare condition where brain cells become damaged over time and certain sections of the brain start to shrink.
conditions.label: Corticobasal degeneration

conditions.snippet: Everything you need to know about complex regional pain syndrome including symptoms, causes, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Complex regional pain syndrome

conditions.snippet: Read NHS information about minor head injuries, including how many people have head injuries each year, how they are treated, possible complications and how to avoid serious head injury.
conditions.label: Minor head injury

conditions.snippet: Find everything you need to know about Toxic Shock Syndrome including causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment, with links to other useful resources.
conditions.label: Toxic shock syndrome

conditions.snippet: NHS Choices information on thyroiditis, with links to other useful resources
conditions.label: Hashimoto thyroiditis

conditions.snippet: Norovirus, sometimes known as the winter vomiting bug, is the most common stomach bug in the UK, affecting people of all ages.
conditions.label: Norovirus

conditions.snippet: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a group of behavioural symptoms that include inattentiveness, hyperactivity and impulsiveness.
conditions.label: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
synonyms: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, predominantly hyperactive impulsive type
Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, hyperactive impulsive type

conditions.snippet: Postural tachycardia syndrome (PoTS) is an abnormal increase in heart rate after sitting or standing up. It typically causes dizziness, fainting, sweating and other symptoms.
conditions.label: Postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome

conditions.snippet: Achalasia means that your gullet has lost its ability to move food along and the valve at the end of your gullet fails to open to allow food to pass into your stomach
conditions.label: Achalasia

conditions.snippet: Cancer of the womb (uterus) is a common cancer of the female reproductive system that often causes abnormal vaginal bleeding.
conditions.label: Primary malignant neoplasm of endometrium

conditions.snippet: A snake will sometimes bite in self-defence if it is disturbed or provoked. Some snakes are venomous and can inject venom (toxin) as they bite.
conditions.label: Snake bite

conditions.snippet: Gonorrhoea is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by bacteria called Neisseria gonorrhoeae or gonococcus. It used to be known as "the clap".
conditions.label: Gonorrhoea

conditions.snippet: Read NHS information about syphilis, including the causes, symptoms and treatment of syphilis, with information about how to prevent infection and links to useful resources.
conditions.label: Syphilis

conditions.snippet: Trichomoniasis is a common sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by a tiny parasite. It can affect women and men and is treated using antibiotics.
conditions.label: Trichomonal vaginitis
